docs.lead_paragraph: I received a thought-provoking e-mail message from Robert Reich, who served as labor secretary under President Bill Clinton, advised the Obama campaign and teaches at the University of California, Berkeley. Referring to my interview with President Obama in this Sunday's issue of The New York Times Magazine, Mr. Reich writes:
docs.abstract: The former labor secretary says power is missing from the discussion about the financial rescue.
docs.snippet: The former labor secretary says power is missing from the discussion about the financial rescue.

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, May 1, 12:50 p.m. | Harley Shaiken, professor at U.C. Berkeley, argues for preservation of the industrial base.

headline.main: Does the U.S. Need an Auto Industry?

docs.abstract: Many domestic industries long ago moved to other producing countries. Why is the auto industry different?
docs.snippet: Many domestic industries long ago moved to other producing countries. Why is the auto industry different?

docs.lead_paragraph: Leading senators from both parties said that they would make changes in Medicare to reward or penalize doctors, hospitals and nursing homes according to the quality of care they provided.

headline.main: Medicare System Overhaul Proposed by Two Senators
headline.print_headline: Medicare System Overhaul Proposed by Two Senators

docs.snippet: Leading senators from both parties said that they would make changes in Medicare to reward or penalize doctors, hospitals and nursing homes according to the quality of care they provided.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a short while, Peter Baker and Adam Nagourney, correspondents for The Times, will begin a conversation about tonight's presidential news conference here on The Caucus.
docs.abstract: The hourlong news conference begins at 8 p.m.
docs.snippet: The hourlong news conference begins at 8 p.m.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is a transcript of President Obama’s press briefing as he marks his 100th day in office, as transcribed by Federal News Service.
docs.snippet: Following is a transcript of President Obama’s press briefing as he marks his 100th day in office, as transcribed by Federal News Service.

docs.lead_paragraph: The gap between supply and demand for doctors in the United States could widen significantly if the training of doctors keeps failing to keep pace with population growth and a rising need tos cater to the aging demographic.
docs.snippet: The gap between supply and demand for doctors in the United States could widen significantly if the training of doctors keeps failing to keep pace with population growth and a rising need tos cater to the aging demographic.

docs.lead_paragraph: The confirmation of Kathleen Sebelius allows President Obama to fill the last vacancy in his cabinet with a seasoned politician who will take charge of the fight against swine flu.

headline.seo: Senate Confirms Sebelius as Health Secretary
headline.main: Senate Confirms Kansas Governor as Health Secretary
headline.print_headline: Senate Confirms Kansas Governor as Health Secretary

docs.snippet: The confirmation of Kathleen Sebelius allows President Obama to fill the last vacancy in his cabinet with a seasoned politician who will take charge of the fight against swine flu.

headline.main: Dealing With the Swine Flu Outbreak
headline.print_headline: Dealing With the Swine Flu Outbreak

docs.lead_paragraph: In his first 14 weeks plus two days, President Obama has made a strong start at addressing the most critical of the failed policies and urgent threats that he inherited.
docs.snippet: In his first 14 weeks plus two days, President Obama has made a strong start at addressing the most critical of the failed policies and urgent threats that he inherited.

docs.lead_paragraph: Once money from the federal stimulus package is gone, and a tax increase on the highest earners ends, deficits are expected to grow.

headline.main: State Finance Plan Predicts Peril When Gains Expire
headline.print_headline: State Finance Plan Predicts Peril When Gains Expire

docs.snippet: Once money from the federal stimulus package is gone, and a tax increase on the highest earners ends, deficits are expected to grow.
